Award.AwardTitle: 2011-12 Annual Meetings in ENG: High-Impact Science Changing the World

Division.LongName: Div Of Engineering Education and Centers

Award.AbstractNarration: This award provides funding in FY 2011 to Ann Becker and Associates, Inc. (ABA) to provide conference planning and support services to the Engineering Research Centers (ERC), the Industry/University Cooperative Research Centers (I/UCRC), and the Emerging Frontiers in Research and Innovation (EFRI) Programs during FY 2011 and FY 2012.

POR.DRECONTENT:
For over 30 years, Ann Becker and Associates, Inc. (ABA), has provided full-service meeting management and consultation to three programs within the Engineering Directorate of the National Science Foundation. The annual meetings of the Engineering Research Centers (ERC), Industry / University Cooperative Research Centers (I/UCRC), and Emerging Frontiers of Research Innovation (EFRI) programs brought together the program grantees to share their research activities, seek out potential collaborations, and exchange ideas and best practices for managing and sustaining research endeavors.

In the Spring of 2012, ABA determined that it was time to “pass the torch” to another consulting firm or internal team, so that Ann Becker could focus more time on designing and hosting experiential learning trips to Central America. Also about this time, NSF was directed to reassess its meetings and events to make sure they were productive, efficient, and a responsible use of federal funds. Within this context of transition, ABA has provided hourly consulting at NSF’s request to help the ERC, I/UCRC, and EFRI programs transition to a new meeting and event structure.

 ABA has provided tools and guidance to the ERC program and its new subcontractors to ensure a smooth transition for the annual meeting attendees. For the I/UCRC program, meeting planning was transferred internally; ABA ensured the continuation of program planning efforts involving two other subcontractors to NSF. The EFRI program’s annual meeting became integrated with the Emerging Researchers National Conference (ERN) supported by NSF and the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS). ABA provided consultation to help EFRI integrate the priorities of what had been a standalone meeting into the framework of a more broadly focused, larger meeting.

 ABA is proud and honored to have partnered with NSF and an amazing breadth of talented and visionary researchers, and hopes that its efforts have supported the goals of collaboration, collegiality, and the sharing of knowledge.
